name: axisymmetric
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
having halves, sides, or parts that are not exactly the same in shape or size: She was wearing a black and white dress with an asymmetric hem. Asymmetric haircuts were very fashionable in the 1980s.
not equal or equally available between two people or groups: Negotiations that end conflicts are rarely equal, but usually asymmetric in their outcomes and in their power bases. In the presence of uncertainty, there may be asymmetric information among the agents. Related word
asymmetrySee also
asymmetric bars
asymmetrical septal hypertrophy
asymmetric warfare
More examplesFewer examplesThe magnetic field that surrounds Saturn is axisymmetric, though that is not true for the other planets in our solar system. The explosion generated an axisymmetric cloud of dust that rose and spread over the city.Much of the problem is caused by the asymmetric division of labour within the home.
